title: Generative AI in Marketing
what: Title slide introducing Generative AI in Marketing course covering concepts, tools, and hands-on workflows. Application-oriented guide for MBA and executive learners.

title: Gen AI Landscape for Marketing
what: Overview of AI landscape: Foundation Models (GPT-4, Claude), Fine-Tuned Models for marketing tasks, and Application Tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, Runway). Maps AI applications across marketing funnel - Awareness (ad copy, social media), Conversion (landing pages, email campaigns), and Retention (personalized messaging, customer support). Includes tool selection criteria: output quality, integration, cost, brand safety, and compliance.

title: Using LLMs for Marketing Content
what: Explains Large Language Models (LLMs) and their limitations (hallucinations, bias, overconfidence). Four-step prompting framework: Define Role, Define Task, Add Details, Refine Outputs. Applications include ad copy variations, email campaigns, and website content using ChatGPT, Claude, and Jasper.

title: Transformer & Attention: Why AI Understands Context
what: Technical explanation of Transformer architecture, Attention mechanism (focusing on relevant context), Tokens & Embeddings, and Context Windows. Practical tips for maintaining brand voice: define tone early, reference previous outputs, use style guides. Strategies for when context is lost: re-state guidelines, summarize key points, start new chat.

title: RAG, Perplexity & Accuracy
what: Explains why LLMs hallucinate and introduces Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) - Retrieve from trusted sources, Augment with AI, Generate fact-based output. Covers Perplexity AI workflow for factual research and marketing applications: policy pages, competitive research, market trends, product specifications. Warning: confidence doesn't equal correctness.

title: Prompt Engineering as a Core Marketing Skill
what: Five-element prompt structure: Role, Objective, Context, Constraints, and Output Format. Compares Zero-Shot (AI infers) vs Few-Shot (provide examples) prompting. Example prompt for eco-friendly sneakers targeting Gen Z. Applications: persona-based ads, localization, A/B testing using ChatGPT, Jasper, and Notion AI.

title: Gen AI for Performance Marketing & Growth
what: Distinguishes Generative AI (creates content) from Predictive AI (analyzes patterns). Four-step workflow: Generate 20-30 ad variants, Shortlist themes, Test manually for top performers, Optimize with data. Applications in Ads (Google Performance Max, Copy.ai), SEO (Surfer SEO), and CRO (landing page variants). Emphasizes human review and faster experimentation cycles.

title: AI-Driven Personalization & Customer Experience
what: Four-stage personalization cycle: Customer Data input, AI Generation of personalized content, Delivery via email/web/chatbot, and Feedback Loop for continuous optimization. Explains real-time adaptation beyond static segments and risks of over-personalization (privacy, uncanny valley). Applications: personalized emails, dynamic landing pages, AI chatbots using ChatGPT, HubSpot AI, and Salesforce Einstein.

title: Creating Marketing Videos Using Gen AI
what: Compares traditional (days/weeks, expensive) vs AI-assisted video workflow (hours, cost-effective). Five-step process: Generate Script (ChatGPT), Paste to Tool, Select Style/templates, Auto-Captions, and Export. Covers Text-to-Video and Avatar-Based approaches. Tools: Runway, Pictory, Synthesia, Descript. Ethical note: disclose AI-generated content.

title: AI-Generated Voice & Music for Branding
what: Explains how neural networks create audio from training data. Voice Cloning (requires permission) vs Synthetic voices. Four-step workflow: Paste Script, Choose Voice/describe mood, Generate Versions, Select Audio. Applications: brand jingles, podcast intros, video voiceovers. Tools: ElevenLabs, Suno, Adobe Podcast. Copyright warning: verify commercial rights.

title: Course Grading & How to Score an A
what: Application-focused grading: A grade for custom Gen AI project with implementation, B for working demo/prototype, C+ for attendance and basic participation. Individual and group work options. Key message: course rewards building, testing, and learning by doing, with creativity encouraged.
